donor_name: Les Amis Du Liban a Monaco
outputs.output_descr: UNDP ART GOLD Lebanon adopts strategic planning approach to achieve balanced and sustainable development by relying on three main pillars, namely, the participatory approach ensured by the working groups, local economic development, and the support of decentralized cooperation. Within this framework, UNDP works with the Lebanese Government to ensure the active participation of regional and local authorities, local communities and stakeholders while striving to fulfill the objectives of the Millennium Development Goals. UNDP ART GOLD Lebanon operates in four regions of the country, namely, North and South Lebanon, Bekaa and Beirut Southern Suburbs, with a coordinating central office in Beirut. Governance, Local Economic Development, Social Welfare, Health, Environment, Gender Equity and Education are UNDP ART GOLD's main fields of intervention at local and national levels.

donor_name: Les Amis Du Liban a Monaco
outputs.output_descr:
Development of a local network entitled to improve long-term strategic socio-economic development in the region through communication and cooperation between the municipalities and centres for development services and the charity organizations associations. This is carried out based on a strategic development plan associated with the concerned ministries.

Monitoring the activities at the primary health care centres to ensure the implementation of the appropriate approach to primary health care. 

Implementation of various activities, such as: health education; identification and monitoring of the prevalent health problems; raising awareness on proper nutrition and maternal and child care including immunization and family planning; prevention from chronic diseases and enhancing psychiatric health; provision of essential drugs, etc.

donor_name: Les Amis Du Liban a Monaco
Agencia Catalana de Cooperación al Desar
Les Amis Du Liban a Monaco
outputs.output_descr:
While the forests of Lebanon are a unique feature in the arid environment of the eastern Mediterranean, they are currently facing serious threats. The consequences of the current forest degradation on the ecosystem and its components are translated into soil erosion, loss of fauna and flora biodiversity, micro-climate change, loss of soil organic matter and soil fertility, desertification, decrease in soil water infiltration and stored underground water, as well as increase in run-off which leads to mudslides and floods, lower agricultural productivity, and negative impact on the socio-economic and livelihoods of local communities.

The long-term goal of this project is community-based protection and restoration of forest and woodland resources as contribution to greater ecosystem stability and improved rural livelihoods. The immediate objective is to establish a pilot forest, fruit tree & fruit tree nursery including herb production in West Bekaa, providing a source of income for local communities and municipalities while providing support to MoE in implementing the National Reforestation Plan.

donor_name: Les Amis Du Liban a Monaco
outputs.output_descr:
The project is focusing on:
 Increasing income generation and job opportunities by focusing on agriculture and agro-industries (milk, beekeeping, fruits and vegetables, fishery and handicraft) 
 Activating the role of agricultural extension through the establishment of a soil and water laboratory at the Lebanese Agricultural Research Institute (LARI)
 Implementating a project to improve the productivity of dairy cows in cooperation with the Agricultural Cooperative Association for Livestock Breeding and Feed Cultivation and Processing in Akkar.
 Implementating a project to improve the services provided to the fishermen in Al Abdeh port in Akkar, and to increase their productivity through the provision of fishing techniques and the distribution of new equipment. 
 Implementating of projects to support beekeepers and improve their productivity, in addition to working on the rehabilitation of pastures through the cultivation of nectar types of plants that constitute the main source of food for bees in the regions of Akkar and Minnieh-Dinnieh.
